SEARCH

Class PatternEliminator

java.lang.Object
PatternEliminator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Eliminator
public class PatternEliminator extends Object implements Eliminator
A class that represents eliminators that know how to eliminate any occurrence of any of a given set of pattern sequences
Author:
PCO Team

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PatternEliminator(List<Symbol[]> patterns)
    The new eliminator will know how to eliminate, through method eliminateSequence, any occurrence of any of the pattern sequences defined in list patterns

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    eliminateSequence(Symbol[] sequence, int blockSize, Symbol nothing)
    Eliminates, in array sequence, any occurrence of any of the pattern sequences defined in the constructor (by order in that list of patterns); Eliminating a symbol means replacing it with symbols nothing;

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • PatternEliminator

      public PatternEliminator(List<Symbol[]> patterns)
      The new eliminator will know how to eliminate, through method eliminateSequence, any occurrence of any of the pattern sequences defined in list patterns
      Parameters:
      pattern - List of pattern sequences

  • Method Details

    • eliminateSequence

      public int eliminateSequence(Symbol[] sequence, int blockSize, Symbol nothing)
      Eliminates, in array sequence, any occurrence of any of the pattern sequences defined in the constructor (by order in that list of patterns); Eliminating a symbol means replacing it with symbols nothing;
      Specified by:
      eliminateSequence in interface Eliminator
      Parameters:
      sequence - Array with symbols where the elimination is to take place
      blockSize - This parameter is ignored
      nothing - The symbol to be used to replace eliminated symbols, creating "holes"
      Returns:
      0 in case no sequence has been eliminated; the number of eliminated elements otherwise
      Requires
      sequence != null and nothing != null
